channel.title: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel
channel.description:
Track list;
1. Welcome 2 Hell Produced by Havoc
2. Fastlane Produced by Supa Dups
3. The Reunion Produced by Sid Roams
4. Above the Law Produced by Mr. Porter
5. IΓΓé¼Γäóm On Everything Feat. Mike Epps Produced by Mr. Porter
6. A Kiss Produced by Bangladesh
7. Lighters Feat. Bruno Mars Produced by Eminem, The SmeeZingtons & Battle Roy
8. Take from Me Produced by Mr. Porter
9. Loud Noises Feat. Slaughterhouse Produced by Mr. Porter
10. Living Proof (Bonus)
11. Echo (Bonus)
[url=http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6446638/Eminem_-_Bad_Meets_Evil__Hell_The_Sequel__%28MP3%29%28NEW_ALBUM%29%282011%29]TORRENT[/url]
it sounds good so far.. tell me what you guys think. (If the link to the torrent isn't allowed; well.. remove it.)

item.title: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Mopman:

I too liked Recovery more than anything else he’s done recently. None of it holds a candle to his old stuff though obviously.

I personally still believe that No Love and You’re Never Over are two of the best songs he’s ever written, even outdoing a large majority of his old music.

Read full topic

item.title: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

The best songs are Fastlane and Lighters anyway. In A Kiss he disses Justin Bieber as well, but that’s not anything too special either.

item.source: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel

item.title: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Recovery was just at attempt to cater to the masses.

Relapse was more dark and hardcore.

[quote=“Speljohan, post:3, topic:398227”][quote author=jme link=topic=495362.msg3625396#msg3625396 date=1307803094]
I don’t like it. Theres really not even a single good song on the album (imo)

Most people would disagree with me, but relapse was his last good album. Hes becoming an old man now nearly 40 years old, he should give it up now.
[/quote]Not that i like anything this twat has ever produced, but age is irrelevant, and 40 is hardly anything. Halford is 59 and still going strong.[/quote]

Thats because you listen to old-man music

Read full topic
item.source: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel

item.title: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Eminem has been and still is one of the greatest rappers of all time. Not only because he is white and can relate to a whole other audience then rappers of other races but also because he is honestly a lyrical genius (like Greeny said). There are few other rappers that can do what he does and sound like he sounds.

@jme: You can’t be serious that Relapse was his last good album (I personally found that album to be ehhh, anyways…). But http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recovery_(Eminem_album) is a great album, much better then Relapse in my opinion.

Read full topic
item.source: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel

item.title: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I dislike rap but Eminem is a lyrical genius, that shit cannot be disputed.

If you disagree, go learn about rhyme then take absolutely any Eminem song and listen to it.

Read full topic
item.source: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel

item.title: Eminem - Bad Meets Evil: Hell The Sequel
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:3, topic:398227”][quote author=jme link=topic=495362.msg3625396#msg3625396 date=1307803094]
I don’t like it. Theres really not even a single good song on the album (imo)

Most people would disagree with me, but relapse was his last good album. Hes becoming an old man now nearly 40 years old, he should give it up now.
[/quote]Not that i like anything this twat has ever produced, but age is irrelevant, and 40 is hardly anything. Halford is 59 and still going strong.[/quote]

Hell brawl, a landscape of the bones
Still filled with no remorse
Such pickings for the crow
Who dances on a throne?
The mover

Let perish be the world
The culling of the heard
And end is what we seek

Suspended disbelief
Abominations grief
The sea of evolution
Our world of destitution

No light, no air, no light, no air, no exit

Excruciating pain
Demoralized again
The wrecking has begun
The sickening undone

No light, no air, no light, no air, no exit

For witness had it’s way
Death sentence comes today
So struggle at the brink
It’s time to be extinct
Upon a broken back
Hear every bone go crack

A gutless withered flesh
Led forward on it’s leash
Flat line in the abyss
Where nightmares reminisce

No air, no light, no exit
No air, no light, no exit

The confrontations rest
No air no light no exit
Flat line in the abyss
No air, no light, no exit

Read full topic
